title: A new edition of the Chronicon Anonymi Cantuariensis, 1346-1367
abstractText: The Chronicon Anonymi Cantuariensis, 1346-67 was published in 1910 by James Tait without a translation and from a manuscript which lacked a large portion of the text, from 1357 to 1364. A new manuscript of the complete text, including the missing section, has now been found, and it is from this manuscript that this new edition and translation, which is being jointly prepared by myself and Dr. Charity Scott-stokes, will be edited. Oxford Medieval Text has agreed in principle to publish this new edition. A substantial introduction will also investigate the process of new-dissemination in late medieval England.
